item.title: 51% Attack
item.description: A 51% attack, also known as a majority attack, occurs when a single person or group of people gains control of over 50% of a blockchain’s hashing power.

item.title: Bitcoin
item.description: Introduction On January 3rd, 2009, the first Bitcoin block was mined by Satoshi Nakamoto, the pseudononymous creator of Bitcoin. Inscribed within the block was a message.

item.title: Proof of Stake
item.description: Introduction Proof of Stake is an alternative mechanism to Proof of Work used by many cryptocurrency networks to achieve consensus on which new blocks to add to their blockchains.

item.title: Proof of Work
item.description: Benefits & Issues of Proof of Work There’s a difference between users and miners (also known as block validators). Anyone can use a blockchain to make transactions or execute smart contracts.
